name: Salamander Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived on a Sunday afternoon for a two night getaway at Salamander Resort and spa in Middleburg, VA. Middleburg is a small town in Loudon County, deep in the heart of horse country and wineries. The resort opened just a few months ago and has good buzz in the region as a luxury getaway destination that's less than 40 miles from Washington. We usually go to the eastern shore of MD for our annual December getaway, but opted for a shorter drive this year.
reviews.title: A Salamander, well done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in the town of Middleburg and passed just one road sign referencing Salamander Resort; it said that it was 0.9 miles away, but we never saw another sign that would direct a traveler to the resort. After two or three turnarounds and re-routes on the iphone map app, we found ourselves driving onto the property via an understated driveway that lead to the resort. It is an impressive drive up to the main building and it is easy to visualize how lush and green the views would be were it not December. A young man met us to valet the car at the main entrance and another young man stood a few feet away to hold open the main door. Neither offered to help with getting our luggage out of the trunk. And upon entering the foyer we had to turn back to them to ask where the check-in desk was located ( to the left). At the desk we were warmly greeted, an offer to take the luggage was made; overall a swift check-in process, but the valets/doormen might need a refresher; they are the first impression gatekeepers.
reviews.title: Weekend I'll never forget!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort's main lobby is stunning. It was decorated for Christmas and presented a feeling of being in a grand---but not stuffy--living room of a great estate house. The Wine Grill is off one side of the lobby and the library , full of books and table games, off the other. Beyond the lobby rooms is the back lawn which lead to trails for the stables, a fire pit and the other amenities on the grounds. We'd requested a room on a high floor, but were told we'd have to wait a while for one to open up, so we were fine staying on the main floor in a room that was ready then. The hallways are long and beautifully decorated with photos by Ms. Johnson, artwork and tasteful furniture peices. Because the resort is more expansive ( wide) than tall ( four stories, I believe), its something of a long walk if your room is on the farther end of the buildings. Our room was exactly as described: an estate king with a large bathroom, gas fireplace and an L-shaped sofa area. It was well decorated and the furnishings, fixtures and amenities were what you'd expect in a luxury resort's room. (My wife was particularly impressed with the special face towels for removing makeup, but thought the ornate tub was too small). Absolutely no complaints about the room. Our view of the winter landscape of bare trees and brown brush was ---again, another reminder to come back in the spring.
reviews.title: Wonderful weekend getaway

reviews.text: We ate a late lunch in the Grill the first afternoon of our stay and found the food there was fine but basic. The service from the main waiter ( possibly the bartender) was a bit indifferent. He oddly referred to us as "ladies" (plural) and gentleman (?) and didn't have much to share about the resort or area after we mentioned we were out-of-state guests. When we were done, he brought the check, but without a pen, and then disappeared. After nearly ten minutes of expecting him to return, I found a random resort worker and borrowed a pen from him to sign the bill. The Grill experience is the only ding that I would give to the level of service at Salamander. It fell a little below expectations and as I noticed that locals/visitors were flowing in and out of the bar ( apparently to watch football on the bar's tv), I'm assuming that they don't rely on the resort guests for their primary source of business at the Grill.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel and even better staff!

reviews.text: Our room rate included breakfast each morning and it was excellent each day. The order taker was extremely efficient and made little adjustments and recommendations about the menu. She was also accurate to within five minutes for the time the food would arrive at our room both mornings. The servers were also very warm and friendly and eager to share info about the spa and the town.
reviews.title: Equestrian Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Salamander Inn in Middleburg, VA over a weekend while we visited local wineries. The place is very well done and we thought it was a gorgeous property. The room we had was amazing - had a fireplace and large bathroom. The price was kind of high but we did get a special $100 credit back for use at the hotel (which was quickly used up at the bar/restaurant!). The workout facilities are top notch, the bar and area around it are very nice, and the restaurant was very very good. We walked around the stables and visited the horses - again, this was all very nice.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Resort - Expensive

reviews.text: They do have a $25.00 "resort fee" and this, in my opinion, is a very cheesy extra cost considering how expensive the rooms are - in November this resort fee doesn't seem to buy you much if anything except maybe the workout facilities since its too cold to do anything outside. Parking yourself will be a far walk back on a busy weekend ... the $25.00 resort fee includes 'parking' but this place out in the country so there is no premium to park here like a city. It would be nice to at least provide more than coffee and some light pastries in the morning as part of the room/resort costs - a simple continental breakfast station doesn't seem like too much to ask? They did give us a newspaper (like any hotel would for free).
reviews.title: Picky Princess is Thoroughly Enchanted in Middleburg

reviews.text: The one problem we had was that half the lights in our room did not work when we checked in - we had to delay getting ready for dinner while we waited for maintenance - after several calls to the desk they came up but could not fix the problem ... at that point we put out a 'privacy' sign while we got ready for dinner and never heard back from them again. Finally after continuing to wait we called again and were told that they couldn't help us because the privacy sign was shown (!?) - calling us back may have helped. We gave up and left the room since we had to go to dinner ... it seemed to me that at least a round of free drinks would have been a great touch considering our initial inconvenience without half of our lights - but that didn't happen. Regardless by the time we got back to our room later that night the lights were working again.
reviews.title: do not plan your event here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also - they have a lot of cozy looking gas fireplaces (and even in the room) - but none of them have a fan to blow out the hot air so they aren't warm! Suggest installing fans in the gas fireplaces to get some heat out of them for guests coming in from the cool weather!
reviews.title: Loved it....

reviews.text: Overall a very nice place - super friendly staff and great rooms/facilities ... just a few minor kinks to work out and perhaps allows the managers give customers something back (a free round of drinks, etc) if they are inconvenienced for some reason!
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: I visited the SR with a couple of my friends, and only to find out that this place is a joke. Half the managers have no clue what's going on. For the price it is ridiculous. 1st the servers at Harriman's, they were unprofessional. The host Amber was a delight. The GM Trey only greeted certain guest, I guess you can say they were VIP's, he didn't even acknowledge the second class guest that were there in the restaurant. I guess you have to be high up to even get a hello from the GM!!! Disappointing. In for in room dining, I came across 2 server's named Laura and Corey who never told us that gratuity was included in our bill, so we tipped them twice, which I don't think is very polite not to mention that gratuity is included. I wonder who else they have got like this. Other than that in room dining was excellent, they were right on time! Prompt service is what I enjoyed about in room dining. I might just come back because of in room dining. They answer the phone with such a great pleasant. Hope they lower the room rates, because it is not worth the $550/night. Step it up!!! Not a 5 star resort, will it get there, not if they keep this up. Thanks
reviews.title: Wasn't worth $550.00 a night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well after alot of consideration I decided to keep my reservation and go to the Salamander Resort as a surprise trip for a birthday girl. When I walked in I was taken a bit back by how beautiful the resort is. There was somebody playing a beautiful piano in the main lobby area and the library was lovely and relaxing. The entire resort smelled like fresh flowers because they are everywhere and that rocked my socks. The firepits are so comfortable and nice and cozy even on a cold night. The only things that bothered me slightly is that they hold an additional $200 in addition to the price of reservation that I did not read anywhere. We had dinner at the Harimanns Resturant and the service was ok the macroni and cheese is DELICIOUS and we where offered a dessert on the house for the birthday girl. I felt like everybody in the hotel greated you with a warm smile and asked if you need anything. It was overall a good experience. The rooms are beautiful and I slept like a baby thanks to the awesome bed. I would have like to rated 3.5 stars to more accurate.
reviews.title: I went despite negative reviews...

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Salamander resort for one night get away. We live in DC area so it's a short drive. The property is beautiful and brand new. The rooms are spacious with beautiful balcony and fire place. Those are all pluses. I give the place 3 1/2 starts because for a place that charges 550/night, I expect a little more. The food is ok, not great and they really need to work on that. We had room service for breakfast and I was expecting being in the middle of country fresh baked goods and farm produce which wasn't. not even fresh squeezed oj.
reviews.title: beautiful property but needs some work

reviews.text: The spa is very small and they charge 40 for use of facility which is a steam room and a small jacuzzi. I think that should be part of facility again if you are charging so much. The indoor pool nice and the sauna next to it.
reviews.title: Great place but still a few kinks to be ironed out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would go again, if they have better prices and if the food quality improves.
reviews.title: Salamander Excellence

reviews.text: For those of us who live in the Washington Metropolitan area, we have been watching this place being built over the last several years. We’ve watched it start from a spa to a mini-resort, to what it is now, a sprawling oasis amidst Virginia’s wine country and upper class elite. When you arrive to this place, it’s almost like stepping back in time but in the 21st century. From the bell staff to the greeters to the front desk and hotel staff, you have truly arrived in grand style! When you walk into the main lobby, you are immediately taken aback by a huge great room with fireplaces and large windows and doors that lead to an open air veranda overlooking the horse stables and fire pit. Off of the great room is a beautiful mahogany paneled library with some of Ms. Johnson’s personal books – very impressive. If you have an opportunity to walk the property, do walk the corridors of the meeting space. On display is some of the most beautiful and classical pieces of art and tapestries you could ever find all in one place. Now to the rooms. My room was well-appointed with every comfort you could think of to make your stay comfortable. From marble baths complete with claw foot soaking tubs, to cordless phones, fireplaces and overhead reading lamps, to the top of the line linen - no detail was spared. If I had one complaint, it would be the room was not as sound proof as I would have liked. I could hear my neighbors TV and conversation from the bathroom. Otherwise, great comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Impressive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To the food. We had an opportunity to peruse the menu. As you can expect, it is very expensive. You can skip the $20 sandwiches with 22% surcharge and delivery fees and go downtown Middleburg by hotel shuttle, to the Market Salamander and get if for half the cost. I digress. We did have the opportunity to eat at Harriman’s, on the property, and the food was absolutely delicious. The staff was attentive and served our meals in somewhat of a cirque du solei act. The food was perfectly season and well paired with some of the best Virginia wines.
reviews.title: An amazing experience!
Wonderful Thanksgiving
reviews.text: All in all, this place is absolutely stunning and if you are fortunate enough to have the opportunity to stay here, do expect to be impressed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to take a day trip from Northern Va for a spa day and we could not have been happier with the service/environment. As soon as we walked in, the staff was there ready to greet us with smiles and helpful hands. We then went to the spa for a treatment and it was fabulous. The staff was welcoming, accommodating and very sweet. The massages were very nice as well. We felt that we were treated like we were the only guests of the day. The spa itself is gorgeous, relaxing and inviting. Joanne was very sweet.
reviews.title: Hunt Country Rejuvenation!
Great retreat for small events
reviews.text: We then had lunch and drinks at the bar there. The food was delicious and we had a WONDERFUL bartender, Nick. He was attentive and very kind. He told us all about how the resort got started and knew a lot of information about the resort itself.

description: Salamander Resort & Spa offers the refined sophistication of a luxurious country estate in the Virginia's exclusive horse and wine country, just 40 miles from Washington, D.C. This luxury Virginia getaway brings together today’s sought after key elements of time-saving accessibility, authenticity of cultural and historical experiences, unique culinary and wine programming, and an innovative spa and wellness concept.Just 35 minutes from Dulles Airport, the 340-acre resort is located within the historic village of Middleburg, VA, which houses more than 100 unique shops, restaurants, surrounding wineries and equestrian fields and provides the backdrop for one-of-a-kind leisure and group stays as well as spectacular wedding and social events.
